text:
Raskolnikov laughed, shaking Porfiry's hand. 

Razumihin cursed, staring at the broken glass. 

“Damn it!” he muttered, turning to the window. 

Porfiry chuckled, searching for answers. 

Zametov stood, surprised, a smile on his lips. 

“Raskolnikov,” he said, “not even a good morning?” 

Razumihin’s back remained turned. 

“I called you Romeo,” Porfiry teased. 

“Pig!” Razumihin shot back, still facing away. 

“Why so furious?” Porfiry laughed. 

“Damn you all!” Razumihin snapped, then burst into laughter.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov and Razumihin navigate a humorous yet awkward social encounter with Porfiry Petrovitch and Zametov, highlighting their contrasting emotions.
